description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President Donald Trump commuted the sentence of Ozy Media co-founder Carlos Watson, a White House official said Friday, just before Watson was due to report to prison for a nearly 10-year sentence in a financial conspiracy case.
title: Trump Commutes Sentence of Ozy Media Co-Founder Carlos Watson

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said he will rest over the weekend after leaving hospital Friday evening.
title: Portuguese Prime Minister to Rest After Leaving Lisbon Hospital

description: Elon Musk is set to visit the Central Intelligence Agency on Monday, the latest stop on a tour through the US government’s spy apparatus that’s provoked alarm from some Democrats and intelligence experts.
title: Elon Musk Set to Visit Central Intelligence Agency Next Week

description: A federal appeals court will lift restrictions on the role that Elon Musk and people affiliated with his Department of Government Efficiency Project can play at the US agency that oversees foreign humanitarian aid.
title: Appeals Court Lifts Doge Limits at Aid Agency Amid Musk Fight

description: President Donald Trump’s pick to police Wall Street’s financial crimes plans to hang onto holdings in Apollo Global Management, American Express and a digital asset platform, according to documents released Friday by the Office of Government Ethics.
title: Trump’s Pick for Wall Street Prosecutor Will Keep Apollo Stock

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: World on Standby for Trump’s Next Tariff Blast

description: President Donald Trump said he was open to negotiations that would reduce the tariffs he’s planning to implement on countries next week, but that he didn’t expect deals ahead of his April 2 announcement.
title: Trump Open to Tariff Negotiations, Will Hit Drug Imports ‘Soon’

description: A divided federal appeals court in Washington will allow President Donald Trump to fire members of two independent agencies.
title: Appeals Court Will Let Trump Fire Independent Agency Heads

description: President Donald Trump has pardoned Arthur Hayes, Benjamin Delo and Samuel Reed, the three co-founders of the storied crypto exchange BitMex, according to a person familiar with the matter who asked not to be named as they were not authorized to speak publicly.
title: Trump Pardons BitMEX Crypto Exchange Co-Founder Arthur Hayes

description: US Secretary of Health and Human Services Robert F. Kennedy Jr. joined West Virginia’s governor, Patrick Morrisey, on Friday in declaring the latest front in their war on unhealthy foods.
title: Soda Companies Are Next Target of RFK Jr.’s Health Agenda

description: The US Agency for International Development will be merged into the State Department by July 1 and “substantially all” of the aid agency’s remaining personnel will be fired, according to a congressional notification sent Friday.
title: US Aid Agency Set to Merge With State Department on July 1

description: Polish presidential candidate Slawomir Mentzen prompted outrage from opponents after saying he opposes abortions for rape victims as the country heads toward an election in May.
title: Polish Far-Right Presidential Candidate Hit for Abortion Stance

description: President Donald Trump announced that he had reached a deal with the law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom to provide at least $100 million in pro bono legal work for priorities of his administration, the latest instance of a white-shoe firm offering services to avoid possible sanction by the federal government.
title: Trump Says He’s Reached $100 Million Pro Bono Deal With Law Firm Skadden

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he expects European allies to share more military intelligence and ramp up joint air defense and artillery production.
title: Ukraine to Get More Intelligence From Europeans, Zelenskiy Says

description: Canada is headed for a period of weaker growth and higher inflation as a trade war with the US snarls business investment and exports, economists forecast in a new survey.
title: Economists Slash Canada Growth Forecasts as Trade War Strikes

description: Vice President JD Vance landed in Greenland with the clearest marching orders yet from his boss to claim the remote and resource-rich Arctic island as US territory.
title: Vance Arrives in Greenland as US Guns for Control of Island

description: The Kremlin has a deliberate strategy to test how far US President Donald Trump is willing to go in pressing Europe to ease sanctions, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: Putin Tests How Far Trump Will Go Against Europe on Sanctions

description: President Donald Trump plans to host El Salvador President Nayib Bukele in Washington next month, people familiar with the matter said, after the Central American leader agreed to jail hundreds of alleged Venezuelan gang members deported from the US.
title: Trump Plans to Host El Salvador’s Bukele at White House in April

description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker will lead a trade mission to Mexico next week as President Donald Trump prepares a new round of tariffs for what he calls a commercial “Liberation Day” for the US.
title: Pritzker Heads to Mexico to Talk Trade as Trump Readies Tariffs

description: South Sudan’s government said it placed First Vice President Riek Machar under house arrest after intelligence reports showed the former rebel leader was planning subversion.
title: South Sudan Says Vice President Detained for Plotting Rebellion

description: President Donald Trump said he spoke with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and that the two would meet after Canada holds elections, amid an intensifying tariff war between the neighboring allies and major trading partners.
title: Trump, Carney Talk Amid Trade Spat, Plan to Meet After Election

description: China has warned Washington that it will retaliate against the US if the Trump administration presses ahead with new reciprocal tariffs on the country next week, according to a report from state media.
title: China Warned US on Reciprocal-Tariff Reprisal, State Media Says

description: Since Donald Trump’s return to the White House, US companies have all but abandoned the green bonds that were once touted as a way for corporate America to have a hand in fixing the planet.
title: Corporate America Ditches Green Bonds as Trump Emboldens GOP Attacks

description: South Africa’s Democratic Alliance criticized the African National Congress’s reluctance to share control of economic policy, escalating an impasse over the budget that’s strained relations between the two biggest parties in the nation’s coalition government.
title: South Africa’s DA Slams ANC Lack of Compromise in Budget Talks

description: Alvaro del Castano just got a major promotion to be the new co-head of Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s business in Iberia. That may spell an end to his side-gig as a political op-ed writer blasting the current Spanish government.
title: Goldman’s Spain Head Wrote Scathing Op-Eds on Country’s Premier

description: Nikola Corp. founder Trevor Milton was pardoned by President Donald Trump for his fraud conviction over the electric-truck maker’s financial progress, according to a White House official.
title: Nikola Founder Trevor Milton Pardoned by Trump After Fraud Conviction

description: India and Sri Lanka are likely to sign a defense-cooperation pact, a first-in-decades development that has the potential to counter Chinese aggressiveness in the Indian Ocean region.
title: India, Sri Lanka Likely to Seal Defense Pact to Counter China

description: Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to let his administration resume deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members without hearings, escalating a high-profile showdown that is testing the ability of federal judges to enforce limits on the president’s power.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Allow Venezuelan Deportations

description: Two law firms sued the Trump administration Friday, challenging executive orders against them that the firms say are meant to scare off opposition to the president.
title: WilmerHale, Jenner Hit Back With Suits Challenging Trump Orders

description: Overdue US funding for the World Trade Organization is under a Trump administration review, adding strains on an institution whose mission of lower trade barriers is threatened by the US president’s planned launch of so-called reciprocal tariffs.
title: US’s Overdue WTO Funding Caught in Broader Trump Budget Review

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s popularity plunged to all-time lows largely due to economic challenges that are plaguing leaders around the world rather than his own policy missteps, Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said in an interview.
title: Brazil Finance Chief Pins Lula’s Falling Support on Global Woes

description: The European Union is identifying concessions it’s willing to make to Donald Trump’s administration to secure the partial removal of the US tariffs that have already started hitting the bloc’s exports and that are set to increase after April 2.
title: EU Plans Concessions for Trump After Reciprocal Tariffs Hit

description: Canada’s economic growth came to a halt after a solid start to the year as tariff threats mounted.
title: Canada Economy Stalled in February Amid Tariff Threats

description: A key Republican lawmaker called on President Donald Trump to renegotiate the US-Mexico-Canada free-trade agreement in order to provide an off-ramp to new tariffs on automobiles announced this week.
title: Trump Should Redo Mexico-Canada Trade Deal, Key Lawmaker Says

description: Israel’s military struck Beirut for the first time since a ceasefire between the country and the Lebanon-based Hezbollah militant group started in November.
title: Israel Strikes Beirut as Ceasefire With Hezbollah Frays

description: The US Department of Defense said it will terminate a plan to use Oracle Corp. software to manage its civilian workforce as part of the Pentagon’s cost-cutting efforts.
title: Oracle, Leidos Contract Targeted by US Pentagon Cost-Cutters

description: Apple Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc. are set be hit by fines under the European Union’s Big Tech competition rulebook toward the end of next week, with the iPhone maker facing the added threat of recurring penalties under the bloc’s Digital Markets Act.
title: Apple, Meta Face Modest Fines as EU Seeks to Avoid US Tensions

description: Germany’s prospective ruling coalition parties sounded optimistic as they prepare to enter the final stretch of talks to resolve differences between Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz’s conservatives and the Social Democrats.
title: German Coalition Parties Downplay Differences Ahead of Key Talks

description: Keir Starmer’s director of communications, Matthew Doyle, quit his post, marking the second senior departure from the UK prime minister’s Downing Street operations in nine months.
title: Starmer Communications Chief Quits in Downing Street Shakeup

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Delivers a TikTok Challenge to China

description: The pandemic closed campuses and pushed enrollment off a cliff, yet two months of Trump is already causing more disruption.
title: It’s Nonstop Disaster Planning on College Campuses

description: With DOGE cutting deep at the tax agency, more Americans might feel emboldened to dodge payments.
title: Trump’s IRS Cuts Are Tempting Taxpayers to Cheat

description: South Africa is working to reset US relations that have been under assault by Donald Trump since his return to the White House.
title: Targeted by Trump, South Africa Seeks to Reset Trade Relations

description: Little more than five years ago, staff at Brazil’s central bank pulled out all the stops in the midst of the pandemic to construct a digital-payments system that would give their compatriots access to free and instant money transfers.
title: Brazil’s Shrinking Central Bank Stokes Worries Over Financial Supervision

description: President Donald Trump is about to reopen a trade-war front with China left over from his first term: protecting American business from copycats.
title: Trump Targets Chinese IP Theft Again as Firms Lament Slow Fixes

description: President Donald Trump dismissed the disclosure of Houthi attack plans in a Signal chat as a “glitch” with no impact on national security. Intelligence experts argue that it gave foreign adversaries priceless insight into US spycraft far beyond the obvious.
title: Trump’s Team Signal Chat Exposed US Spycraft to Adversaries

description: Iran’s foreign minister said his country responded to a letter from US President Donald Trump on the prospect of new talks over Tehran’s nuclear program, without giving detail on the contents.
title: Iran Says It Replied to Trump Letter on Nuclear Talks

description: Moscow must balance its ties with both Beijing and Washington, a top Russian official said, highlighting the emergence of a new geopolitical dynamic between President Vladimir Putin, China’s Xi Jinping and Donald Trump.
title: Russia Says It Wants to Balance Relations With the US and China

description: Ekrem Imamoglu, the Turkish opposition figure whose detention this month triggered mass protests and a market selloff, criticized Western leaders for their muted response to his arrest.
title: Turkey’s Jailed Mayor Decries West for ‘Silence’ on Erdogan

description: Societe Generale SA named Alexis Kohler chairman of its investment bank, tapping French President Emmanuel Macron’s longstanding top adviser to oversee one of its key businesses.
title: SocGen Taps Macron’s Top Adviser to Head Investment Banking

description: Myanmar’s junta chief Min Aung Hlaing will visit Thailand next week to attend a regional leaders’ summit, a rare trip to a neighboring Southeast Asian country since the military seized power in a 2021 coup.
title: Myanmar Junta Chief Set to Attend Regional Summit in Bangkok

description: The UK government has put a target to boost homebuilding at the center of its growth plans. The companies that will actually deliver those homes are already telling shareholders they won’t get close to achieving it.
title: The UK’s Key Housing Target Is at the Mercy of Wary Homebuilders

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to improve market access at a meeting with a group of global business leaders in Beijing, in an effort to boost investor sentiment as rising tariffs fuel uncertainty for the economy and international trade.
title: Xi Woos Global Business Leaders as Trump Intensifies Trade War

description: Myanmar’s government has agreed to release four Thai fishermen, who were detained by its navy in November, according to Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.
title: Myanmar to Release Thai Fishermen Held Since November, PM Says

description: Pete Hegseth pledged to deploy additional advanced capabilities to the Philippines amid threats from China as the Pentagon chief faces calls at home to resign for sharing attack plans with other US officials over the Signal app.
title: Hegseth Reiterates 'Ironclad' US Pledge to Defend Philippines

description: Nippon Steel Corp. shares slumped on Friday on a report that the company is considering investing as much as $7 billion to upgrade United States Steel Corp. facilities if it wins approval for its proposed $14.1 billion takeover.
title: Nippon Steel Slumps on $7 Billion US Steel Investment Report

description: President Donald Trump signed a proclamation directing the Smithsonian Institution to remove references to “improper ideology” from its programs and exhibitions, the latest effort from the White House to crack down on teachings regarding race and gender.
title: Trump Directs Smithsonian Sites to Scrub Content on Race, Gender

description: The University of Michigan is scrapping its once-vaunted program for diversity, equity and inclusion as the Trump administration pressures colleges to abandon such efforts and after months of criticism over its cost and effectiveness.
title: University of Michigan Scraps DEI Program Amid Trump Pressure

description: After decades of failed attempts, scientists were optimistic that a new generation of HIV vaccine candidates would finally succeed — changing the course of a pandemic that’s claimed more than 42 million lives since 1981. But that hope is now dimming as the US moves to pull vital funding.
title: Fruits of Decades of AIDS Vaccine Research Imperiled by Trump’s Withdrawal of US Funding
